positive.review:
wow. 
played this game for 300 hours and not a SINGLE lootbox. my lawyer (john from accounting) will hear about this
3 years of grind... all the way from 1st antimatter to the end. I don't regret a single minute spent in the game. Played it on mobile until the Reality update. The story is actually insane.
I've been playing for a while, saw number go up, yet I still dont know what the fuck im supposed to do in this game. 10/10 would recommend
this game is great but also addictive and will suck your time away and possibly a big chunk of your life, please avoid. 10/10

322 days and 765 hours of active play later, I have finally beaten this game. It was an absolutely wonderful experience. 

One of the few idle and incremental games I've played that actually incentivizes an active play style and rewards it with genuinely engaging and honestly quite complex mechanics that all intertwine with each other. 

10/10 experience with this 10/10 incremental game. Would recommend if you enjoy idle / incremental games.

i poured boiling water over my thumb and now i can feel it trying to cook itself its been 2 hours


uhhh also good game recommend
many mechanics so it doesnt get too boring, numbers go big, really big, and it has lots of mods so once you beat it you can change it up and play it again.

Never thought an idle (incremental) game can have this fun. Strongly recommended.

Out of 10, I would rate this game a solid e9e15.

Between the web version, the Android app, and Steam, this game has successfully synchronized my addiction across all known platforms. I have spent 40 days watching numbers go up. I could have learned a new language. I could have gotten abs. Instead, I made antimatter.

10/10 would ruin my life again.
number go up great, and news ticker awesomes n funnys n very vital to survivalz
Surprisingly addicting, no microtransactions, just a good "game"

Numbers go up in its' purest form. 

Would recommend for devout Idle enjoyers.
Eternity is taking an eternity i just want it to be over i fcking hate this shit, would recommend

Probably one of the best idle/incremental games I've ever played. There are definitely some points in the game that are the average boring waiting game that a lot of incrementals have issues with. However, more often than not, it was engaging and figuring out the strategies and most optimal upgrade paths more than outweighed the negatives of those boring bits. I would greatly recommend to anyone that enjoys incrementals.

Игра "Antimatter Dimensions" – это увлекательный и затягивающий кликер с глубокой системой прогрессии. Сначала ты просто зарабатываешь Antimatter, кликая по кнопке, но очень быстро открываешь измерения, которые сами приносят Antimatter. 

Чем дальше продвигаешься, тем сложнее становится, и тем больше новых механик открывается: Infinity, Eternity, Dilation и другие перезагрузки с бонусами. Тут приходится строить сложные стратегии, чтобы максимально оптимизировать получение ресурсов и продвигаться к новым целям.

Графика простая, но функциональная, и вся информация легко читается. Игра хорошо оптимизирована и работает плавно даже на слабых устройствах. Она отлично подходит для тех, кто любит наблюдать за постоянным ростом чисел и экспериментировать с различными стратегиями. "Antimatter Dimensions" – это игра, в которой всегда есть, чем заняться, и всегда есть, куда расти. Она идеально подходит для убийства времени и для тех, кто хочет окунуться в мир экспоненциального роста.

I finally did it
We'll meet again





But for real dont play this, once you get to dilation almost the whole game is timewalls and RNG for glyphs

Just numbers, silence and a constant feeling of progression... unlike real life.
This game gave my brain enough time to realize that I exist solely because two people had sex, thank God I'm lesbian and won't commit such crime.
this game consumed my life for 150 days and there's really nothing else like it. highly recommend to anyone that enjoys numbers going up

wow. 
played this game for 300 hours and not a SINGLE lootbox. my lawyer (john from accounting) will hear about this

To anyone wanting to play an idle game which starts really simple, but gets quite complicated, do yourself a favor and try this out. I like idle games, and I've played a lot of them, and this one stands out. Honestly, get it, it's finished, you can play it to the end. 

There is no NG+ you just unlock a new cosmetic or something, and can only restart the entire game. Which means that once you've finished it, you can only replay it for speedrunning purposes. But my point is that it feels great that you can actually finish it, even though it takes really long, it's a very good experience.

Can't recommend it enough to people who enjoy idle games.

One of the best idle games ever made, the utterly ridiculous numbers you get even just a few hours in make my autistic brain tingle with excitement. Currently, i'm just over 1e3100 Antimatter, and that is not even 1e-5000th of the way to the theoretical endpoint. If you need a game to put on in the background while you do college work or just have running while playing other games, this is one of the best choices. 7/7, highly reccomend
3 years of grind... all the way from 1st antimatter to the end. I don't regret a single minute spent in the game. Played it on mobile until the Reality update. The story is actually insane.

Full transparency here, I've played and beat this game once pre-reality, and twice post-reality. This is the best Idle Game ever made. There is so much in it but it's almost never overwhelming, yes there are walls, but they are frontloaded and don't appear much post-reality*. I am not kidding when I say this game inspired me to learn JavaScript, and do programming in general. Also this game was a better math teacher for me than my Algebra II teacher. Logarithims are my bitch. 
* you know the outliers if you've played it, otherwise, GO PLAY THIS GAME. 
** 5 hours.

probably the best idle game i've played, every step of progression feels finely tuned. although i can't speak to the experience without following a guide, luckily there are plenty of guides and threads about every stage of progression. the game continuously evolves as you unlock more and more options to enhance your resource generation, but it never gets bogged down in complexity, because you're always automating a previous tier of content at the same time.

it's kind of insane this game is free for the amount of content you get out of it. whether you want to play the game in the background or more actively manage it, the game lets you choose your own playstyle. plus it has great offline simulation so you don't feel pressured to leave your pc running 24 hours a day.

on top of it all, it's balanced without microtransactions, so if you're looking for an idle game this one has pretty much everything you could want.

[b]One of the best incremental games I ever played, possibly the best.[/b]

It keeps things fresh with new mechanics, while the earlier content stays relevant through challenges. It has months of content, without introducing layers so complex it's impossible to understand without guides.

It is genuinely free to play, I never felt limited by not spending money.

The game becomes somewhat of a puzzle game, trying to figure out what setup you need for challenges and how to push progression in certain places, which I find really cool, but this puzzle-like nature also led to the only major flaw I can think of.

In some of the challenges and parts of late game progression, you can go in with an incorrect setup, and only find out hours later, when your progression plateaus falling short the goal, so it essentially costs hours to check if your "solution to the current puzzle" is correct. Looking at guides becomes an obvious escape hatch, but I generally believe games should be solvable without a wiki. It's definitely solvable, but it can get very frustrating, I personally ended up using a guide for a lot of the late game progression, but it still ended up feeling very satisfying.


Still, it's definitely in the pantheon if incremental games, pretty much spawning it's own sub genre of "AD-like" games, with none of them managing to dethrone it as far as I'm concerned.
[b]If you are into idle / incremental games at all, you should definitely try this.[/b]
fun idler, months-long progression, limited complexity (in a good way)

this game is great but also addictive and will suck your time away and possibly a big chunk of your life, please avoid. 10/10

Considering this is my third full play through of the game, it is pretty good. It took about 50 days and 30 minutes to complete since save file creation so definitely my best time yet. Lots of fun for those who like this sort of thing, but can be a bit confusing. There is a very well done online guide that I have utilized a lot, so if you get stuck, use it.

From a simple and a little weird curiosity Antimatter Dimensions became one of my Games of the Year. I am dead serious. DEAD. F*****G. SERIOUS. 
This is a shinning example of what clever, well though out, and playful game design can do with a seemingly uninteresting concept. The last time I was in such awe of pure game design was Vampire Survivors. This game, or rather this design deserves more exploration. 
Do it or I will steal it for my own game!

A simplistic incremental game, you progress mostly offline, but there are also challenges that you have to play actively. I dont usually play a single incremental game this much but this game didnt bore me. Also the news section has so many texts and easter eggs.
Perfect for passing time, deep gameplay, with surprising replayability for an Idle Game.
Im only on the third major reset layer and its so peak, most likely the biggest incremental out there.

If u think the early part of this game is fun u are about to embark on a journey spanning months.
Cant recommend it enough.

very well balanced, lots of different fun mechanics and progression stages
10/10 best idle game I've ever played

Wasted 5 months hoping to finish the game.

Try this at your own risk.

Game is good, but I should I not have started it.

Probably the only "idle" game that got me engaged enough to finish it, though there are quite a lot of sections that slows progress exponentially by idling instead of playing actively; guides are really helpful.

I loved it, yes it is boring at the early game but the more you play the more it becomes more fun with some stages in between being a nuisance

THE best idle/incremental game ever! Its just so satisfying to watch da numbers go up!

Amazing incremental game with a lot of content, prestige layers, and unlocks that keeps you engaged. It is easy to pick up, but also has a decent amount of complexity that you can learn. Progression is satisfying and feels rewarding.

Imagine if AdVenture Capitalist was 20 layers deeper and had a real ending.
Love this game. There is a lot of action. Just the last four hours I saw a number go up maybe two or three times.

Long, complex, clever mechanics to learn and make numbers grow. A play between manual work and automation upgrades that makes it easier as things gets more complex but always relevant for tinkering or in later states of progression subverted.

Big con is eventually realising some complex number mechanics was not always intuitive, as in its hard to compare what makes numbers go up the best in the stack of complex interleaving functions; and thus going to a guide for reasonable progression (x10 - x100 gains, or even progress locks if you dont do exactly what is wanted) which takes away from the experience. 
This is combined with a bad GUI layout which you have to click around many different tabs and drop-downs to get a stat you need to remember in the moment to make a decision in a later tab too buy or tweak automations; making AD also a memory game when reviewing what changed or needs to change next.

This "numbers goes up" game picks up a story after a few 100's hours. Was curious, at this point its became a long story unlocked with strategy and puzzles. 

So make sure you get concepts like infinities down (not infinity points), and resetting prestige correctly for best gains, and knowing how the eventual talent tree (time studies) interact and knowing how to solve eternity challenges correctly, because its going to pickup in a new form later and you'll likely get progression stalled there.

Worth it. The END is a great feeling and freedom to just stop clicker games for a while.
better than cookie clicker 10/10, haista vittu perkele saatana
i haven't even scrapped the surface of this game. if you like idle games, this game is perfect.
i cant stop i keep seeing antimatter in the sky all the time now i think i have been playing for like 9999 days now.
it feels like drugs getting injected directly into my brain. peak PEAK
Very good game, but it's way too short.

Spoilers below:

The best incremental game I've played despite many of its quirks and minor flaws. Many elements of the game are puzzle-like from certain challenges to some of the bosses in the game (especially The Nameless Ones). Things like the time studies tree is fun to play around with and master as you progress from the moment you unlock it. The added story elements after you unlock RM with actual dialog snippets adds a nice touch. Really makes you feel like this emerging force of nature. The destroyer. The credit music adds a nice layer to it as well, both alluding to the possibility that you'll restart the game and also giving a somber send off to the celestials.

It's also the only incremental game I know where at some point it simply hands you a rudimentary programming language and has you make your *own* automation. Really, the game gives you a lot of freedom to explore, and while the game may be an 'idle' game, there's often plenty of reason to be actively involved with it. If you need help, generally the discord has good resources (pre-made scripts, step-by-step guides), though I think for the best experience, one really should do at least some of the game on their own/blind.

Overall a great time. For a free game, one can get a lot of mileage out of it.  Highly recommended for anyone looking for something that's more art/puzzle than raw entertainment.
I can't believe I sat there and read through the entire ESSAY about snakes.
probably the best straight forward incremental game out there

negative.review: i cant recommend this game to anyone. i enjoy it, but for the wrong reasons. it is unplayable without consulting a guide...
It is a fun idle game, however for me progression takes way too long. I'm not even close to finishing. In fact i'm just at the start of the game despite having 123 hours in-game.

Most of you who read this, will likely have played other idle games, possibly more than I have (only a handful), so I will refrain from explaining what an idle game is and why it's very different to most video games.
I find this one very drawn out, somewhat repetitive (currently gathering the first dozen eternity points and there's one particular infinity challenge that I can't be bothered to repeat, as it requires too much manual intervention) and it's losing my interest, as I expected newer mechanics to unlock a bit faster at this rate.
i cant recommend this game to anyone. i enjoy it, but for the wrong reasons. it is unplayable without consulting a guide...

I left my computer on with the game running for a bit. Tell me why I came back and it was using 24GB of RAM?! My computer was slowly crashing and I was getting error popups stating that Microsoft Windows was not responding and asking if I wanted to end the program. Hello?? Microsoft Windows wants me to end Microsoft Windows?? Because of some stupid idle game that's pushing my resource usage to 100%?? GTFOH! Idle games are never beating the "secretly a crypto miner" allegations.

It's the same thing, over and over and over and over and over....

Yes, it's free, so one should not complain.  However, it's boring as boring can get.

Imagine working on a spreadsheet that never changes.  You get minor (VERY MINOR) upgrades along the way, but you're still looking at the same spreadsheet - forever.
My friend Sally introduced me to this game but I don’t really like it just play cookie clicker it’s better :/
It's repetitive and it's hard to progress.
Not fun to start in 2025
No Idle, timewall game
Made me lose the game
I'm not a fan of waiting.

It is a fun idle game, however for me progression takes way too long. I'm not even close to finishing. In fact i'm just at the start of the game despite having 123 hours in-game.

Most of you who read this, will likely have played other idle games, possibly more than I have (only a handful), so I will refrain from explaining what an idle game is and why it's very different to most video games.
I find this one very drawn out, somewhat repetitive (currently gathering the first dozen eternity points and there's one particular infinity challenge that I can't be bothered to repeat, as it requires too much manual intervention) and it's losing my interest, as I expected newer mechanics to unlock a bit faster at this rate.
i cant recommend this game to anyone. i enjoy it, but for the wrong reasons. it is unplayable without consulting a guide...

I left my computer on with the game running for a bit. Tell me why I came back and it was using 24GB of RAM?! My computer was slowly crashing and I was getting error popups stating that Microsoft Windows was not responding and asking if I wanted to end the program. Hello?? Microsoft Windows wants me to end Microsoft Windows?? Because of some stupid idle game that's pushing my resource usage to 100%?? GTFOH! Idle games are never beating the "secretly a crypto miner" allegations.

It's the same thing, over and over and over and over and over....

Yes, it's free, so one should not complain.  However, it's boring as boring can get.

Imagine working on a spreadsheet that never changes.  You get minor (VERY MINOR) upgrades along the way, but you're still looking at the same spreadsheet - forever.
My friend Sally introduced me to this game but I don’t really like it just play cookie clicker it’s better :/
It's repetitive and it's hard to progress.
Not fun to start in 2025
No Idle, timewall game
